name: places/ChIJi4mN_p9ZwokR3xm7RmBe9Xg
adrFormatAddress: 315 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003-2707, USA

originalText.text:
Readers should be aware that this RESPITE center is NOT a treatment center. It is staffed by peers and is non-profit. It is not a hotel. It is not a shelter. It is not a hospital. It is a place for mental health patients to take a break from their usual environment and rest.
I went here for a week when my sister passed away. I got what I needed, privacy to grieve.
The web site is pretty clear what the center is for. Check your expectations.

originalText.text: FALSE ADVERTISING DO NOT GO HERE IF IN CRISIS: Having a psychiatric/mental health crisis? Feeling mentally sound to navigate the intake process? Have 3-6 weeks to just hang about & wait to get into a crisis center? This is the place for you!

text.text: FALSE ADVERTISING DO NOT GO HERE IF IN CRISIS: Having a psychiatric/mental health crisis? Feeling mentally sound to navigate the intake process? Have 3-6 weeks to just hang about & wait to get into a crisis center? This is the place for you!

originalText.text: I stayed here for 28 days was a blessing for me I was going through a crisis in my life and this was relaxing and very soothing, Staff is super friendly and they make it real good for you here

originalText.text:
MYstay the was disappointing
At best. There are no groups,
The staff is nasty and intimidating at times so are the clients. THe director was unfriendly I'd been there before
She didn't even say hello .
The rooms are okay but you can hear through the walls.

originalText.text: This is not a doctor's office.  It is a short stay residence which affords clients the opportunity to unwind and relax in a supportive environment which includes meals, quiet, and group therapy provided by volunteers and paraprofessional program staff.  There is access to a computer and staff to assist with clients making linkages with medical, housing, legal and social services, including longer term shelters and assistance to make application to more permanent housing programs.
